programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Kentucky has claimed victories over Louisville in their last four consecutive meetings, winning the most recent matchup on March 29, 2023, with a 7-4 scoreline; Erin Coffel posted a game-best 3 RBIs for the Wildcats in the win at home.

programme.desc: SEC teams prepare for their upcoming opponent with practice sessions and work inside the film room, featuring coaches drilling their players and offering advice, an exclusive look at how the schools game plan, and exclusive talks with team members.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: No. 8-ranked LSU is 9-4 all-time against No. 9-ranked Oklahoma after earning a 5-4 victory at the 2022 Shriners Hospitals for Children College Classic at Minute Maid Park in Houston, as Jordan Thompson hit a solo HR in the bottom of the 11th inning.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle

programme.title: High School Basketball
programme.desc: Prolific Prep is led by Kansas signee Darryn Peterson, the No. 2 recruit in 2025, along with Gabe Nesmith and Obinna Ekezie, both top-10 recruits in 2027; Long Island Lutheran features Syracuse signee Kiyan Anthony, the son of Carmelo Anthony.

programme.title: High School Basketball
programme.desc: Montverde Academy/Dynamic Prep winner goes up against No. 2 seed Link Academy, the 2023 champions that are led by Houston signee Chris Cenac Jr., the No. 6 recruit in the 2025 class, and USC signee Jerry Easter, the No. 42 recruit.

programme.desc: Famed former WNBA players Sue Bird and Diana Taurasi offer an alternate telecast to women's basketball games, providing their unique commentary to the action on the court, along with interviews with celebrity guests to hear their thoughts.

programme.title: Formula 1 Practice
programme.desc: Formula One drivers learn the intricacies of the track and communicate to the crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: Professional Fighters League
programme.desc: Featured first-round welterweight bouts: Jason Jackson vs. Andrey Koreshkov; Magomed Umalatov vs. Logan Storley; Mukhamed Berkhamov vs. Florim Zendeli; featured featherweight bouts: Jesus Pinedo vs. Adam Borics; Jeremy Kennedy vs. Movlid Khaybulaev.

programme.title: Bad Beats
programme.desc: Scott Van Pelt and Stanford Steve delve into the rigors of the sports betting world by reliving some of the recent bad beats in recent games, from a last-second shot ruining the line to an over-under being erased due to scoring sprees or droughts.

programme.title: 2025 Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame Class Announcement
programme.desc: The 2025 class entering the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame is officially announced; Carmelo Anthony, Dwight Howard, Sue Bird, Maya Moore, Billy Donovan, Jennifer Azzi and Sylvia Fowles are some of the featured names under consideration.

programme.title: Girls High School Basketball
programme.desc: Faith Family Academy/Montverde Academy winner faces the IMG Academy/Westtown School winner in the championship game of the annual tournament; Montverde Academy won the last three titles after beating IMG Academy in the 2024 final, 61-53.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 19-ranked Mississippi State (25-5) is 3-1 on the road this season after defeating UAB, 8-4, on March 19; Northwestern (13-9) enters the series against the Bulldogs on a seven-game winning streak; inaugural meeting between the programs.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 19-ranked Mississippi State (25-5) is 3-1 on the road this season after defeating UAB, 8-4, on March 19; Northwestern (13-9) enters the series against the Bulldogs on a seven-game winning streak; inaugural meeting between the programs.

programme.title: Professional Fighters League
programme.desc: Top fighters from around the world engage in a full-contact combat sport that allows a wide variety of fighting methods and skills from Mixed Martial Arts traditions as the fighters look to move up the rankings and stake claim to championship gold.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: The premier open-wheel racing organization, Formula 1 originated in 1950 as the top drivers traveled around the world to compete for the series championship, gaining points at each stop based upon their finish in the fast-paced races.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of women's college basketball games.

programme.title: Goliath Fishing
programme.desc: James Marko travels across South Florida on fishing expeditions in hopes of reeling in trophy-caliber fish at each one of his stops, discussing the techniques he implements to find success out on the water and the equipment he uses to reel them in.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Christian Laettner used his brash and boisterous personality mixed with his on-court skills to become one of the most despised college basketball athletes in the history of the sport, as the documentary focuses on why he garnered those sentiments.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Renowned fishing champion Jimmy Houston travels around the world fishing for largemouth bass, crappie and other fish, and he demonstrates his hunting techniques with other athletes, celebrities and friends who love to fish.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Despite losing to NC State in the 1983 NCAA Tournament final, Houston's Phi Slama Jama team, helmed by head coach Guy V. Lewis, was a legendary squad with the likes of Hakeem Olajuwon and Clyde Drexler leading the Cougars to deep tournament runs.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Georgetown (18-15) overcame a halftime deficit to beat Washington State, 85-82, behind 37 points from Malik Mack; Nebraska (18-14) used a strong second half to beat Arizona State, 86-78, behind 30 points from Brice Williams and 18 from Juwan Gary.

programme.desc: Analysts preview the upcoming College Basketball Crown game, breaking down the key players to watch on both teams who could determine the outcome, the latest news and what the two teams will need to do in order to come away with a win.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Butler (15-19) used a strong second half to beat Utah, 86-84, behind 22 points and nine rebounds from Pierre Brooks II; Boise State (25-10) blew out George Washington, 89-59, behind 19 points from Tyson Degenhart and 15 from Pearson Carmichael.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Georgetown (18-15) overcame a halftime deficit to beat Washington State, 85-82, behind 37 points from Malik Mack; Nebraska (18-14) used a strong second half to beat Arizona State, 86-78, behind 30 points from Brice Williams and 18 from Juwan Gary.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Butler (15-19) used a strong second half to beat Utah, 86-84, behind 22 points and nine rebounds from Pierre Brooks II; Boise State (25-10) blew out George Washington, 89-59, behind 19 points from Tyson Degenhart and 15 from Pearson Carmichael.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Dunkerque is coming off of a 2-0 defeat to Bastia in Ligue 2 on March 28 where they conceded goals to Christophe Vincent and Maxime Blé; Paris SG claimed a 6-1 victory against Saint-Étienne in Ligue 1 on March 29, led by a Désiré Doué brace.

programme.title: European Poker Tour

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Pumas UNAM won the inaugural edition against the Whitecaps with a 2-0 victory on the road in the Round of 32 of the 2024 Leagues Cup, as César Huerta and Jorge Ruvalcaba scored; Vancouver advanced past Monterrey on away goals in the Round of 16.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Carlton (0-3-0) is allowing 81.7 points per contest; Collingwood (2-1-0) has won five of the past six meetings, including an 84-81 triumph last season in Round 21, as Mason Cox, Will Hoskin-Elliott and Jordan De Goey each notched two goals.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his first Cup Series win of the season with his victory at Homestead over Alex Bowman, while William Byron holds onto his points lead; William Byron averaged 76.096 mph en route to his win last year over Larson.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: DeeRonn Booker of Albuquerque, N.M. captured his maiden PBA Tour title and became just the third African Ameran to win a major tournament with his victory in last year's edition held at Suncoast Bowling Center in Las Vegas.

programme.desc: Inter Miami CF has won just one of the three all-time encounters but won the last meeting, 3-1, on Sept. 3, 2023, as Lionel Messi had two assists in the second half; Los Angeles FC was the runner-up to Tigres UANL in 2020 and León in 2023.

programme.desc: The life of Bob Quinn was much more than becoming a legend and captain for the Port Adelaide Football Club, serving his country of Australia during World War II and receiving the Military Medal for his actions during the Siege of Tobruk.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Tigres UANL has reached the final four times since its runner-up finish in the 2015-16 edition; LA Galaxy, the winner of the 2000 tournament, defeated Herediano, 4-1, on March 12 to advance; inaugural meeting between the two clubs.

programme.desc: The four highest-seeded teams from the region (United States, Mexico, Canada and Haiti) awaited 22 teams competing in the first round for the final eight spots; the US has won the competition six times while Mexico has the most runner-ups with five.

programme.desc: Melbourne (0-3-0) snapped a two-match winless streak to the Cats with a 74-66 victory at MCG last season, as Bayley Fritsch kicked a club-high three goals; Geelong (1-2-0) has lost two in a row after falling to Brisbane, 70-61, on March 29.
